website_summaries.verdict: With a pole long enough to reach low-hanging limbs or the tops of moderately sized trees, and a motor powerful enough to trim average-size branches or chop logs, this versatile model fits the needs of a variety of users.
pros: The 40-volt motor is surprisingly powerful, and can even handle some thick limbs of soft wood varieties
The pole extends to 8 feet, providing enough reach for trimming dead or overgrown tree limbs most users encounter on their property
The 8-inch chain is oiled by an automatic oiling system, and includes an easy adjust tightening system that makes chain tightening simple
cons: Some users report that this unit uses oil more quickly than others, and may leak during storage

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love it...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this saw right up until it broke! I really like the power, the balance and easy of use. I agree with the other review about the weak point! The same thing happened to me after about 20 cuts. The battery charge lasted longer than the saw itself. The chain no longer spins... It just make a terrible sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Keep an eye on battery charge while it’s not being used.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. The battery seems to be having issues staying fully charged. Doesn’t go dead but drops from 4 stars down to three fairly quickly while being stored. The only problem I have is with assembly of the pole it’s cumbrr to line up the arrows exactly right. I ended up painting stripes so assembly would be faster and easier. THIS UNIT IS NOT INTERCHANGEABLE with better quality Greenworks equipment heads. The cheaper has electrical connection while the better or stronger heads have mechanical connection. Stronger one has motor with battery.
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: Chain comes off
customer_reviews.text: I own a few Greenworks products and this one is the only one that has disappointed, i did not use it much but after some use the chain started coming off, then i would put it back again and it would come back off only in a matter of seconds, i have taken good care of all the products and maintained them regularly including this one. This was supposed to have some warranty, i guess 4 years maybe but the one i have has been lying around for sometime now rendered useless. Dont feel like throwing it away, paid good money for it.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: I usually like Greenworks products
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for awhile there, but.... #1. The chainsaw oil doesn't lubricate just the chain. The oil will sometimes slide off the chain down the pole, to where you put the battery. A potential fire hazard. #2. It started to make a grinding noise and the chain refused to move or flat out fell off. Tried adjusting it half a dozen times to no success. #3. The battery is a bit difficult to remove as well. I usually like Greenworks products, but there is just too many things wrong along with there being a potential health hazard to rate this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Bea A.

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Sold all my lawn equipment and purchased all electric Greenworks. Not happy I did. I have had 2 blowers and 1 string trimmer go bad. The chainsaw I ordered is also missing the oil fill cap. I never tried to do warranty work. But I did try to get the cap replaced. Greenworks never responded to me. Seller also never responded and declined the return since it was out of time. Never again Greenworks.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: chain was not tensioned at factory and manual does not match model shipped
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have searched reviews that mention chain tension I know how to tighten the chain that kept coming off. The manual is way off and as correctly pointed out by several other owners you have to find a set screw in the front of the unit. Maybe if a few more people start giving this otherwise decent pole saw one star ratings these cheapskates will update the manual.
customer_reviews.author: GERALD G. TRAVIS

customer_reviews.title: Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had this pole saw years ago. Some context, I am 5' 6", late 50's, female. I have problems working with my arms extended at or above shoulder level and traditional pole saws don't work for me. This is a miracle tool. It takes a little getting used to the weight in the handle end and how the blade end acts when it starts cutting but after that, I was unstoppable and trees finally got the attention they needed. Crossing branches, dead branches, branches that were too low all trimmed. Very, very happy with this. One word of advice....watch the oil level. It uses more than one might expect.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy S.

customer_reviews.title: Lite weight and it works easily
customer_reviews.text: This tool has Plowed me to manage things better. I have had back problems so the weight of this is something I can handle comfortably. Great tool. The only negative is the chain slips off too easily, but I can put it back on just as easy.
customer_reviews.author: Bettina

customer_reviews.title: A Toy to enjoy for many days;
customer_reviews.text: I am very please with this saw for the work it has done for me so far; My wife doesn't like to use saws but now she will use this one; It so easy to use and the only maintenance is just keeping bar chain oil in it at all times and maybe tighten up the blade ever so often; The bottom line is we are considering buying other line types through this seller with same brand(greenWorks) Happy customer ---We will deal again soon!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Stahley

customer_reviews.title: Dead Battery - Support Nonexistent
customer_reviews.text: The saw is fine, until the battery dies. I've used this thing maybe 5 times. While not using it, I left the battery in the charger. I hadn't used it for 6 months or so and now the battery is dead. Like dead dead. Won't charge. Unresponsive. Tried contacting support several times but got no response. I've seen youtube videos where others have wired 2 batteries together to get enough of a charge that the battery is recognized by the charger. I don't have another battery and I shouldn't have to do this! I've now got a $150 pole. Sucks. As does Greeenworks support.
customer_reviews.author: DKT

customer_reviews.title: Best pole saw
customer_reviews.text: Great saw. Works very well. Every homeowner with trees should have one. Lots of power
customer_reviews.author: Vivian Lesko

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even finish the first 2 branches trim.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, this thing stinks...but the Greenworks line has horrible durability. I have purchased Greenworks products over the last year, for personal use ONLY around my small corner yard. And here is my take on the product line...it's trash. The build quality obviously stinks. My casualty list is as follows: Greenworks Mower - DEAD, within 9 months. Greenworks Hedge Trimmer - DEAD within 6 months. Greenworks Pole Saw - DEAD within 1 week! Greenworks String trimmer - ALIVE! for six months so far, although I did have to replace the trimmer head. Greenworks Blower - ALIVE! for 9 months so far, and no problems. Overall, I view these as a bad investment in lawn equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tool
customer_reviews.text: This rapidly became a favorite tool at our house. It's easy to assemble and it makes trimming branches very easy. The chainsaw at the end is surprisingly effective. It requires a bit of strength and dexterity at full reach, but overall it's a great product. Battery life is around 45 minutes or so; we always have a spare battery on charge, and use the same batteries for our GreenWorks chain saw, weed whacker and hedge trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Clapham

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks cordless pole saw
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this little chainsaw!!!! It is sturdy. It will saw through just about anything. I have had a blast cutting off limbs and vines in our backyard. My husband has been astounded at the piles of limbs and debris that I have been able to clear out. Have saw, will travel.
customer_reviews.author: Puller Lanigan

customer_reviews.title: chincy unit
customer_reviews.text: Handle/pole all wobbly wont stay stiff , saw blade keeps jumping off even when i tighten the screw tightener which is impossible to get to. DOes not hold much oil and get real hot if just doing a couple of branches. Now i do cactus with it and it works good on them but i am doing a oleander bush with max size of 2 inch branches and it overheats. So you decide. I had the batteries and they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: MASTER REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Typical foreign quality
customer_reviews.text: After ~10 hours of use, the pinion gear on the electric motor ground itself into oblivion! I see in some of the other comments that this is a common problem. Good battery, charger, chain, etc. but the metal in the gears that are the heart of this machine are junk!
customer_reviews.author: billsr

customer_reviews.title: Saw worked for 10 minutes then STOPPED working.
customer_reviews.text: The saw arrived approximately 12 days ago. Looked good, assembled easily. Ran trimming limbs for approximately 10 minutes. Stopped for no known reason. Checked all pole fittings, recharged the battery. Checked chain clearance and operation. All normally configured. Still will NOT run. After holding for a long time to speak to a Greenworks service representative (who NEVER answered my call) I tried (THREE TIMES) to file a report with Greenworks via email form provided on their site. Would NOT accept my report. Finally, contacted Amazon for a return to them. Recommend DO NOT but this tool; NOT because of the tool; but because Greenworks was absolutely NOT ANY assistance what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: G. Massey

customer_reviews.title: Powerful fast chain speed surpassed expectations
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, surpassed my expectations. Easy to use, balanced well without center extension. It paid for itself the first time I used it. Gave it a real workout for a good 4 hours on and off trimming limbs from 3 large hemlock trees from 14 ft. Ladder. I didn't need extension. Will reach very high with extension from ground but rather unwieldy, heavy on end. Cuts better than my 40 volt greenworks chain saw. Fast chain speed powers thru large 3" limbs so easy. Very happy with purchase. Time will tell how well it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Great polesaw
customer_reviews.text: Great polesaw. I’ve got 3 gas polesaws in the garage that take a prayer from the pope to get started. I was leery about a battery operated one but I’m very happy with this one. I trimmed 6 trees and the battery outlasted me. The chain did come off quite a few times but I expected that from a new chain. The tool that comes with it is too short for adjusting the chain so have a long screwdriver in hand. The adjuster is pretty flimsy and the standard front of blade location stinks. I like the stihl side adjustment screw best. Overall a great polesaw
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Initial assembly was pretty easy. At first the battery seemed a little hard to remove from the saw and charger though, but after a couple of uses it is easier to remove now. It's pretty well-balanced and light enough to maneuver easily, yet durable enough for tough jobs. The handles assemble and disassemble easily and quickly. The chain is easy to adjust. Be sure to have your jug of bar oil with you while you're trimming. The powerful 40V battery will outlast the bar oil in the oil reservoir. I give this saw an "A" rating for it's durability, easiness of use, assembly & disassembly, power and construction. I recommend this pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Carl

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Battery died shortly after purchase and would no longer take a charge. Called customer service, waited on hold for 30 minutes, and was told I had to have the battery and charger with me so that I could unplug it and plug it back in. They refused to provide a replacement. The saw was weak and did not cut well. Would not recommend and will not to buy any Greenworks products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D

customer_reviews.title: Push a button, it works
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the tool to take for a day in the woods, but it does the small to medium size job around the house. Battery needs charging more often than I would like Perhaps I'll buy another battery. Chain oil reservoir seems a bit small, I need to keep an eye on it. I'm so tired of messing with 2 cycle gas engines. I started buying expensive premixed gas with no ethanol. Maybe the price of premixed gas justifies buying additional batteries. I'm wondering how this will perform in cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: So far it has been great.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this pruning pole several times but I have had it only a few months. So far I have found it to be outstanding. It has cut everything from small limbs to medium trees. I have gone for hours on a single charge. Compared to past poles that I have had this pole is much more rigid and seems to be solid. The one observation I have is that the head is heavier than the end (with battery) and is not balanced. Only time will tell how durable this is but right now I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: STEVE BARTLETT

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke after 1 hour of use. I had the comprable Black & Decker model until it was stolen, so I tried this one out. The chain stops moving after even moderate pressure from a branch. Tried recharging the battery and it still has the same issue. I can't see anything wrong with it but for some reason it doesn't have any more muscle. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Battery would not charge after one use.
customer_reviews.text: I used this once last summer (2019) and it worked very well. I was quite pleased. However, the next time I went to use it, this spring, it didn't work. It appears that either the battery or the charger is defective. I would rate this product 5 stars if not for the battery and/or charger problem which makes this tool worthless. The claim on the Amazon website is 4-yr. warranty. I have contacted the manufacturer and am awaiting a response.
customer_reviews.author: Fussy Guy Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Battery is difficult to install and take out. Wish the product was American made! Adding oil is difficult. Product did not include the chain bar oil! I can’t believe the power this battery pole saw has. We had a hurricane Yesterday and I was cutting 6-8 inch pieces without hesitation the saw worked. You want to have fun this is a cool product to use. Don’t hit the ground with the blade!
customer_reviews.author: duane martin

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is phenominal.
customer_reviews.text: I used my Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw, 2.0 AH Battery Included 20672 to remove overhead limbs hanging over my driveway. The machine ran non-stop the entire 323 feet of my driveway. The battery out lasted the chainsaw bar oil tank. I estimate I cut down, cut up and tossed out over 150 limbs in a 3 hour span. This is a work horse on pole saw. I highly recommend the Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw, 2.0 AH Battery Included 20672
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pole Saw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tree pruning saw, it comes in three sections so that you can make the saw shorter or longer depending on your particular need. You can do many cuts on a fully charged battery. The battery also works with my Greenworks weed wacker.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Gatti

customer_reviews.title: The most important thing.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you carry a small screwdriver with you when you use this for the first 30 minutes because you will need to tighten the chain several times before it stops stretching. People have complained about the chain coming off the sprocket, and it's due to initial chain stretch, just as the instructions warn. Overall, a really great saw with tenacious cutting power. My one complaint would be a want of a thicker string.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Like a hot knife through warm butter!
customer_reviews.text: I really had my doubts about this little jewel but I was very pleasantly surprised. I already had the batteries and charger since I own the Greenworks mower and weed eater. After the recent storms in Texas, I needed to cut a lot of limbs and branches that fallen on my roof from my neighbor's oak tree plus I had to trim back quite a few branches still overhanging my roof. This pole saw cut many limbs from 2 inches to over 8 inches thick easily, very easily. I made at least 50 cuts on one battery pack. I could not believe how great this saw worked. Of course, it's not commercial grade but it definitely did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rodriguez, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw, but difficulties removing battery
customer_reviews.text: I used this pole saw for a number of jobs. It handles and performs very well. Why only 3 stars? I was unable to remove the battery after use. I had to disassemble the saw in to dislodge the battery. Turns out that the guides inside the battery compartment that align the battery with the connector were a bit too tight which got the battery stuck. Filing down these guides solved the problem. Given that I had similar problems with my Greenworks chain saw, I think this is a quality control issue. Not a big deal but very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: new?
customer_reviews.text: to say this item is new would be a stretch. it came in a beat up box heavily tapped that had been shipped previously. the contents were floating around in the box with the wires loose and battery/charger stuffed in open bags. however, the oil reservoir appeared to be unused so i am going to try and keep it. the pole connections appear to be loose, but usable. this should've been labeled "returned, but fairly good condition". wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: June M.

customer_reviews.title: My awesome new friend.
customer_reviews.text: This item is so awesome. I am a68 year old woman whose trees were blown and twisted over my fence lines and had to be removed. Well, all wanted $1,000. plus to do all that work and haul off debris. I bought this as i had no such monies and had to remove the tree limbs to get out or in my gates. Hurricane IRMA left this poor old woman,me, in deep doo doo. Well, got this wonder saw in and have cut and burned so much of it I feel as though another job with no pay. Made no mistake purchasing this little bad boy. I am only 5' tall but having a ball.
customer_reviews.author: SandraLynne Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but help not available when chain stuck
customer_reviews.text: Chain kept sliding and not working. Written in steuctions made no sense, not clear. Called and called and no one would answer. Message said email and I never got an answer so returned the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Peter robinson

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable Cuts
customer_reviews.text: This thing bounces and shakes and will not make a clean cut. I have tried tightening the chain, different angles, dead limbs, thick and thin. I thought it would save time over a traditional manual pole saw. But since the cuts are so rough I had to go back and clean up. See pics. Pros: - good reach - easy to use - makes quick work Cons: - cuts are unacceptable (see pics) - blade jumps and bounces - battery is very difficult to remove - hard to store I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Cabin Builder

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw is excellent for trimming and reducing cut down tree branches. I used it for over two hours and the battery had over half the full charge. The only flaw is the chain tightening adjust screw loosens easily. The screw needs an anti- rotational feature.
customer_reviews.author: Patt B.

customer_reviews.title: Fine - only wish for better battery life
customer_reviews.text: The saw was fine for trimming smaller branches. The battery life was adequate for work around my 1.2 acre yard. Maneuverability was ok with one extension. However, it was more difficult fully extended (with 2 extensions.) At times I wish I could shorten it even more. Over all I would buy it again and would recommend it, with the above caviats.
customer_reviews.author: Ho N. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets
customer_reviews.text: I received my saw, yesterday; charged it fully in about 45 minutes and went to work. It couldn't possibly be easier to assemble and use: plug in the battery, screw in the two extensions, put chain oil in the reservoir and pull the trigger. The chain saw is very aggressive, biting quickly through 6" Bay Laurel limbs. I worked steadily for about an hour and still had 50% battery charge. If you keep oil in the reservoir, adjust the chain frequently and avoid torqueing the bar in the cut you are making, this saw is going to please you.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd J. Goldstein PhD

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw, 2.0 AH Battery Included
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my husband and he loved it!!! Says "Just what he wanted, but better!". Update: Stopped working 9/29/2020, we purchased 12/11/2019, haven't had it a year and the gears that turn the chain are stripped out/ground down? We've done and internet search to see if we can get replacement parts, no luck. Contacted Greenworks, if they make good on their warranty I'll revise my review, we'll see. Otherwise, do not buy. Gave it two stars because it wasn't even a year old and inability to find replacement parts.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy P

customer_reviews.title: The battery & charger that arent included cost more than the saw itself.
customer_reviews.text: Never used it. Still in the box. Does not come with battery or charger and I purchased it on Cyber Monday, so even at normal price the charger & battery cost more than the saw. I could go to walmart & get another saw for less than the battery/charger cost.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not put together well
customer_reviews.text: Used in once for about 30mins. Did what it should. Used in again for about 30 mins. As it should. Used it again for about 3 mins. Worked fine, but when i detached saw pole from battery pole the "male" part of the connection would got stuck so when it came apart in stayed in and pulled out the wires connecting to saw. Very cheap parts and this just should not happen. Called customer service ... they never pick up
customer_reviews.author: NFB

customer_reviews.title: To heavy to handle
customer_reviews.text: My intention was good. I love lithium battery garden tools. I needed to trim the top of some trees & open up some light for shrubs below & shape things up. I got the job done but it was difficult because the saw is so heavy trying to minipulate it on the pole. My back wasn't feeling it afterwords. This devise needs to be much lighter or have some sort of attachment to help distribute the weight. Also, may be operator error but the chain kept coming off. Again, got the job done but not anxious to use this tool again.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Now i have two.
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the the advertisment. A average person can only prune limbs up to 13' with one of these. There is a funny story why I bought another one of these. I put the extra extention piece I had that comes with these on the new one so now I can prune up to 15'. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It Cuts!
customer_reviews.text: The saw could be a little lighter to lessen fatigue; but overall it's very good. One shouldn't be attempting to cut limbs without adequate strength anyways. Haven't run the battery down yet, used it for half hour; albeit part of that time was pulling the cut limbs to the side for loading. Will revisit after longer use. Saw came ready to assemble, connected the extensions, and was easy to do without reading all the pages. KEEP The Bar & chain oil filled! That's it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque  Clouseau

customer_reviews.title: it did an awesome job of limbing and making the firewood and kindling
customer_reviews.text: ok, so I've had this for a year now and I gotta say I'm impressed. We've had to take down 7 trees, all of which were between 50 ft and 70 ft tall. Although the Greenworks was too small to actually cut the trees down, it did an awesome job of limbing and making the firewood and kindling. It's had a workout every day for weeks now. We've had zero problems with this saw. Charger works flawlessly. We have noticed that we can't just charge it immediately after the battery drains but giving it a few minutes to cool down does the trick. damn good saw.
customer_reviews.author: Dogbreath

customer_reviews.title: IT'S NOT AN IDEAL PRODUCT, THE CHAIN COMES OFF TOO QUICKLY.
customer_reviews.text: THE CHAIN COMES OFF A LOT. IT'S ONLY GOOD FOR TRIMMING. BUT BE PREPARED TO CONSTANTLY RESET THE CHAIN CONFIGURATION. THE CHAIN COMES OFF TOO QUICKLY
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Only had the product a short while and, to date, I find it to be a very good product (I don’t know about battery life, I haven’t had it long enough to form an opinion - battery has more than enough power 😀). The only issue I had was the weight/balance when fully assembled but, with a little maneuvering, I worked it out, at least for the hour or so I used it in this condition. The saws cuts well - I used it for four to five inch diameter privets coming over from the neighbors yard.
customer_reviews.author: RHS

customer_reviews.title: Ok- has a problem, if fixed could be great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Pole saw which I am also returning. It has problems but I do like it. The electric motor mount is a die-casting that breaks after a few hours of use. The motor mount should be constructed of high grade steel. If so it would be unbreakable and the product would be outstanding. I have ordered a third pole saw which fortunately is low price without battery and charger. If the third product fails for the same reason, I will return it to Greenworks direct and discuss the problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is no lightweight unit. It is surprisingly heavy. It's no commercial tool, but it is very tough, has a powerful motor, a heavy duty feel to all of it, and it cuts like a monster. The total length is about 8 feet. And it is a handful when reaching out or up to cut a branch. It does require some muscle to lift the saw into position and keep it from hitting the ground when the cut is through. Not a problem for most people, but something to consider if you expect a lightweight feel. I also use the battery for my greenworks blower and just keep the battery charged in case I need either.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Stop and Start problems
customer_reviews.text: It work good for a year, now it has this problem. It will run for maybe a few minutes of sawing then stop and can't run again. It's like there is glitch of some kind with the running. I can lay it down come back in hour or two then it will again for a very short time like maybe 3 or 4 minutes, but stops during sawing. It appears electric thing, I don't know, but $200.00 machine should last longer.
customer_reviews.author: J.R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: WE WOULD LIKE TO RETURN THIS PRODUCT. WE JUST PUT IT TOGETHER AND CHARGED IT TO USE BECAUSE IT WAS ORDERED END OF 2018 TO USE NOW. CHAIN WILL NOT MOVE, EVEN THOUGH THE PERSON USING IT HAS MUCH EXPERIENCE. CANNOT GET THE CHAIN TO MOVE OR WORK EVEN WHEN TROUBLESHOOTING. PLEASE LET US KNOW HOW TO RETURN THIS AND GET A REFUND.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Senesac

customer_reviews.title: Upset
customer_reviews.text: I paid $179 plus tax. Box was torn and retape. Pull it out. Look like it been used already.. wasn't new in my box
customer_reviews.author: TV WAY

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but does the job
customer_reviews.text: I thought the weight might be a problem, but it is not. It adds to the downward pressure to saw through even 6 inch branches. We already had a Greenworks 40v blower, and we really liked the interchangeable battery. I spent nearly two hours cutting branches off our one-acre+ lot and did not need to sway out the battery. I believe my wife will use the same battery to blow the driveway and the sidewalks. I would recommend this little workhorse for do-it-yourself landscapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC
customer_reviews.text: This Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw is Fantastic. This pole saw can be extended up to 8 feet, but it can be shortened for job that don't require an 8 foot reach. The chain saw portion is very sharp and easily cuts through branches and makes pruning a much easier project to accomplish. I have a Greenworks Chain Saw that I received as a Christmas gift, and I can use the 40V battery that came with the chain saw to operate this pole saw.
customer_reviews.author: Joe E. Strange

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic yard tool
customer_reviews.text: I just finished 1 1/2 hours of cutting down 2 -8" diameter branches and this pole saw performed like a champ! This is the 3rd time I've used it and I am very pleased. I previously had a gas powered Toro pole saw/weed wacker and I find this tool much more usable and just as powerful. The biggest advantage is the immediate on/off power that comes with the battery system since using a pole saw is typically a lot of on, off, clear the debri, on, off, etc. This is perfect for that type of work. It is slightly lighter than my gas powered unit and much easier to use. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, Great service
customer_reviews.text: The saw did a great job trimming limbs and the Batt just lasted and lasted. I cut 3 trailer loads of limbs and never needed to charge . When I had a problem I called customer service. I explained what the problem was, they took all my information and they are sending me a new saw. Cant beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if it easily telescoped like the corded Black & Decker I used to have would. Still, it's very handy and cuts great. It's light enough that I can cut with it raised over my head. I'm fit, but no strongman, so if I can do it, most men who are in fair shape can. Very handy that it's cordless, as I have a big lot and there's no need to drag a cord all over. I like the fact that I can open the blade cover without a tool. You do need a screwdriver to adjust the blade tension, though (unlike the Greenworks chainsaw). That's forgivable, to keep the size and weight down.
customer_reviews.author: JeffLearman

customer_reviews.title: cuts
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was going to need a battery 500 volt battery option. Wrong the battery lasts long enough to get the work done. If it stops you will realize it is time for a break! I have been cutting pin oak limbs and some are about 4-5 inch diameter. Not all just some. On average 2-3 inch. I sawed and sawed the battery didn't die and I got up limbs for quite a while. If you are a homeowner this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Bad QA. Missing rivet or fastener.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with missing rivets or fasteners. This doesn’t look broken...it looks like it was never finished being assembled. I guess that happens when you use child labor. However, I would expect them to at least have a 14 year old QA it. What a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: James D. Porter

customer_reviews.title: So cute!
customer_reviews.text: I am having so much fun with this, I will be running out of things to prune very soon. As a special offer I'll come to your yard within 5 miles for free. OK so this is really a cute mean and powerful saw for its size. I only used it without the full extension so far, but it works really well, the balance is good and the battery lasts a good time. The only thing that was missing is that it comes without any chain/bar oil so make sure you order some with your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron E

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw, Gear Stripped
customer_reviews.text: Saw seemed to work good but did not last, after limited use it seems like a gear stripped. Still runs and chain turns until it touches a limb and then stops without sawing. Could have been a good purchase. have not located a warranty service within easy travel distance. Packaging and shipping back to manufacturer would not be easy. Also have Green works 40 Volt Chain saw, weed eater and two blowers getting limited use but all still working. Same battery for each is a plus, have two chargers and a small and large battery. With a little more lasting power it might deserve 4 or 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Texas

customer_reviews.title: First time user.
customer_reviews.text: Liked the saw we cut out a Juniper and by the time we finished we had bought another blade, I didn't know about sharpening LOL. Worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Think I would have loved it but worst customer support ever
customer_reviews.text: Used this saw for only one hour and started making a loud grinding sound and chain would not move. Tried several calls and emails to reach Greenworks for support with no answer back.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Which is worse this or Amazon?
customer_reviews.text: Which is worse this, customer service or Amazon's customer service? This pole saw worked for an hour then the chain got caught. We called customer service for Greenworks wasted 45 minutes on hold then got poor advice. Trying to get through on Greenworks Customer service is not worth the time. This is good for cutting twigs- use it on something 4 inches or more at your peril.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of trees and scrub oak, and this is already one of my favorite tools for trimming branches and cutting the 1" - 4" diameter scrub oak from under the pine and fir trees. The sections go together easily and securely and provide plenty of reach. The power is good - no problem cutting through anything I've tried. The chain is very sharp. Battery lasts longer than I do (90 minutes is my longest session so far). Using the saw without the center extension makes it handle well for ground-level work. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M D M

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had this years ago
customer_reviews.text: Chain fell off at first. Once I figured out how to get the chain tension set properly this tool worked great. The instructions to do this were not accurate, and did not point to the tensioning screw. Just be aware how quickly the chain oil is used up and there will be no problems. The 2 AmpHour battery I used from the GreenWorks Pole Hedge Trimmer surprised me how long it lasts. Was able to cut down 50' of out of control overgrown hedges in two charges. There was so much debris, I had to hire someone to take them away. It turned out to be 8 cubic yards. The tool paid for itself in less than 1 hour.
customer_reviews.author: kasdesign

customer_reviews.title: Will Trim a Twig
customer_reviews.text: This product does not have the necessary torque to operate as a true pole saw. The only thing it will cut is a twig. The chain constantly locks up and the battery is not powerful enough to use it like a normal pole saw. It was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Minda S. Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery Powered Trimmer! Cuts Branches like Butter!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a powerhouse! We have many mature trees in our yard and the branches hang over our driveway as well as our neighbors. We finally got to really use this tonight and WOW! It cuts limbs and branches like butter! We trimmed 4 trees and it still has battery life left! This trimmer is definitely 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: CochinMama

customer_reviews.title: Great little poke saw!
customer_reviews.text: Have 6 acres of Pine, Aspen, and maple trees and the pole saw handled everything easily and made short work of even thick dead pine branches. Battery life is good, unit itself is a little heavy, but that works to your advantage when felling branches as the added weight helps ease the blade and chain through. Only complaint is I had to refill the chain oil often, but really is a minor issue. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kanril

customer_reviews.title: Works well, no tensioner?
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleasantly surprised by the performance of this saw. The bar & chain are of better quality than the combo that comes with the greenworks chainsaw. Only negatives I'd say are: 1. No chain tensioner - however it has only thrown the chain 2x in hundreds of cuts and numerous charges. My concern is that the chain has gotten more slack with use so...we'll see what happens. 2. Reach - I'm 6' 1" and with arms fully extended, overhead, I'm able to reach about 15' which isn't bad but jeez I hadn't realized that greenworks based the reach off of 6' tall people lol.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Does what it promises to do.
customer_reviews.text: What did I use it for? WELL DUH! The battery lasts as long as I need it on my not-all-that-large suburban property. No complaint about that. And it cuts well. The only drawback is that it is very heavy and rather tiring to use, even without the extension pole; the extension pole makes it impossibly heavy, at least for my degree of upper-body and back strength, and I can't use it for the highest branches. Still, I am satisfied that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: 78RPM

customer_reviews.title: Pole Saw Evolved
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw replaces my corded pole saw and manual pole saw/loppers. It uses the same 4AH lithium battery as my GreenWorks lawn mower. 90 minutes of on-and-off cutting used only 1 of 4 LED charge indicators. We cut branches up to 4" in diameter with no bogging down or stalling. There's no cord to drag out and put away or trip on or get caught up in trimmed branches on the ground. The chain is easy to adjust. There's a big knob that loosens the bar and a single screw to tighten the chain. The saw breaks down easily into 3 pieces for storage and comes with a sturdy plastic chain guard.
customer_reviews.author: Adarondax

customer_reviews.title: No Longevity
customer_reviews.text: We go some use out of it for some light pruning one season. Came back to use it the next season and the battery would not accept a charge. The cost of a replacement battery was such that we junked the tool
customer_reviews.author: fredC

customer_reviews.title: The saw didn’t even last as long as a single charge.
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly. Instructions weren’t needed. Charged the battery, added oil and trimmed out my yard. I cut about 12 2”-3” branches in a couple minutes. My garage can dry off and I won’t be ducking while I mow. I spent a couple minutes chopping up the branch pile. It cuts good enough for me, a bit faster than I expected. I took it out again about 2 weeks later and it won’t turn on. I put the battery on the charger Incase it was low with 2 bars remaining but it’s dead. I’m researching the warranty now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected; easier to assemble than expected.
customer_reviews.text: A manual pole is worthless to me. The branch is either small enough that it sways under the saw and I cannot get purchase or too big to really cut from far below. This cordless pole saw eliminates those challenges. It easily comes apart into two essentially four foot pieces making it easy to throw in the car to take to a project. On a habitat restoration project we needed to remove half a dozen 20 ft invasive Norway Maples that were crowded together. With the pole, we were able to clear lower limbs which allowed the trees to come down without much fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Poor internal parts
customer_reviews.text: This pole saw worked great, for about one battery life's worth. The drive gear has stripped out on me twice. The first time greenworks was good enough to send me a replacement, and the new one litterally stripped out on the second battery. So if you want a disposable pole saw, use it on one or two trees then toss it, this is the pole saw for you.
customer_reviews.author: Shea Roberson

customer_reviews.title: Don't take that cover off. That's where you take the chan off.
customer_reviews.text: Yoused it for the first time today. Very pleased so far. Be sure to check your chan tension. After I cut some I seen the chan was a little lose so I fixed that and cute a lot more chan tension held fine. Looks like the chan oiler works really well. Let you know after I use it more. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: D Bresson

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both love this tool. This is our 3rd Greenworks purchase and we love all three machines. We have a lot of trees on our 8 acres and this has easily cut through the limbs of each tree we've tried. It's easy to lengthen and shorten and uses the same battery as the Greenworks lawn mower. We ran out of steam before the battery did. We are both really impressed with this company and the tools.
customer_reviews.author: J. Petrovic

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have tons of trees on my property and most of them needed trimming. I was getting irritated mowing my lawn and having to duck for branches. I was thinking about getting a corded trimmer because they are a lot less money but I'm glad I went with the cordless. This made it very convenient going tree to tree and the 40 Volt battery has more than enough power. This trimmer is very easy to assemble and use. The battery lasted a long time and the chain stayed sharp long enough to complete the task. I would recomend this saw to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: George J Matthews

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are doing a crazy amount of work, the 2.0AH battery is enough for this pole saw. So far I have used it after 3 different storms that brought down several branches around the yard and it has worked really well. Small tip, get one of those generic ketchup like bottles, with a very narrow end, and put your oil in there and use it to pour oil into the chain saw container. I made a mess trying to use the regular oil bottles or a funnel. Next for me is getting the 16" greenworks chainsaw, and I'm planning on use this same battery for it.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Medina

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Live on 10 acres, so I have a couple gas chainsaws that I use often. Got this to reach the higher limbs...wow, nice power, quiet, battery lasts pretty long and charges within an hour no problem. Find myself using it on jobs that I would typically use gas chainsaw for,,,.cuts in logs/limbs up to 6-8 inches. Only gripe is the blade....gets loose often, (for me about every 5 cuts) but the fix takes all of 20 seconds. Got this on a Daily Deal, so definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: CB Coop

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for electric
customer_reviews.text: This is my first electric saw purchase and I was convinced by other reviews that this would replace electric and gas for power and usability. I have not found that to be the case as of yet. The battery does last awhile, but runs out at the most inconvenient time and then you are done. I found the power lacking and seemed to jam or catch quite often.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter H

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to use at work. I was really impressed and have used the saw multiple times with no problems. I would recommend buying a 4 ah battery if you plan on using it alot. I decided to buy one for home use and of course after about the third use the motor started smoking and the saw quit. I contacted the Green Works warranty department and they where super helpful and replaced my saw with a new one in less than two weeks. I would highly recommend this pole saw for home use.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my pole saw for a couple weeks and used it three times. The battery life is great and the tool is easy to assemble and use. Only thing that kept me from giving it 5 stars was the oil reservoir is small, so make sure you keep an eye on the oil level. The battery will easily out last a few oil fill ups. I thinking about getting the green works 14" chain saw next.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis S.

customer_reviews.title: It worked perfectly for average Joe!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an average Joe living in the suburbs with a house surrounded by large mature trees. After a winter of heavy snow and a spring with heavy rain and high winds, lots of branches down and broken. This pole saw and a sturdy ladder made the job super easy! Watch the youtube reviews, GREAT INFO! After two hours, the chain loosened up, easy to tighten. It went through bar oil quickly, keep an extra bottle handy. The first charge on the battery lasted me just a little over an hour and a half.
customer_reviews.author: whiselj

customer_reviews.title: Works well, quiet and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit awkward to use something above your head but it works well. I cleaned up 3 trees with it so far. The blade tension needed to be adjusted out of the box and shortly after use I adjusted it again. The blade hasn't stretched much since and I've used the tool for about 2 hours of cuts over the past week. The battery didn't die in each of my 30 minute sessions. The tool ran quietly and smoothly. I keep adding to my greenworks electric collection happily. They've all worked well so far.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lemak

customer_reviews.title: Manual pole saw replacement
customer_reviews.text: After struggling for years with clumsy pole saws I finally got a battery operated Greenworks pole saw. I have a large elm tree that overhangs my fence and city street and requires trimming because a lot of branches grow downward. The angle of those branches makes it awkward to cut. This chain saw cuts right through them. It’s quickly done.
customer_reviews.author: david r.

customer_reviews.title: Died after two months of use...
customer_reviews.text: I was happily using it to trim up my queen palms here in Florida and it died after two months. I’ve tried contacting support and received no response. I would avoid. I knew I should have went with a brand name I recognize. Lesson learned. I’ll be avoiding Greenworks products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Brian S Swiger

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but leaks oil while stored upright with oil cap on top.
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with how the saw performs. Battery life is a lot better than expected. It requires frequent refilling of the bar oil. Overall I am glad I purchased it. I am not happy that it leaks oil while stored on the wall and parallel with the oil cap at top. It seems to be common problem. I recently purchased it and I don’t feel that is “normal”!
customer_reviews.author: phil f phillips

customer_reviews.title: another nice tool
customer_reviews.text: great little saw for trimming smaller branches. Cuts through quite well, and gives you good reach. It's heavy when extended all the way out, but that's to be expected. Cutting overhead is a little frustrating as you get full of saw dust, but again nothing the saw can do about that. Overall happy with this purchase, hopefully it lasts for a while. I have about 6 of these greenworks 40v tools and I'm happy with all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Spoony920

customer_reviews.title: Great pole saw!
customer_reviews.text: At 85 bucks this is a steal. I use green works for all of my outdoor tools and this unit does not disappoint. I was able to trim two large trees very easilyand only used half of my 4ah battery. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: MrChin

customer_reviews.title: All round great product! Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: The chainsaw is very powerful, and the battery life is incredible. As one might imagine, the weight of the chainsaw at the end of a light weight 8 foot pole is sometimes a little hard to balance, but I can't imagine what would make it better. The one criticism I would have is that the safety catches a little while in operation, so it doesn't shut off quickly when you release your hand. It's SOO useful that my neighbors have been borrowing it.
customer_reviews.author: wwms

customer_reviews.title: I used the product a total of 20 minutes, ...
customer_reviews.text: I used the product a total of 20 minutes, and the product would no longer turn on. I was 10 days beyond the 30 Amazon return timeframe. when I contacted the manufacturer I was informed I must return to 1 of their approved return centers, of which the closest 60 miles away from my home. I returned the unit to Freelends Lawn and Garden as direct. I have still been waiting going on 4 months now. Freelands has been payed for processing the return and I am still with out a saw.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Defective / no customer support
customer_reviews.text: Battery is defective and customer support non-existent. Bought this pole saw not expecting much just for light use trimming branches over my drive way. Battery is defective. Won’t charge. Never worked. Tried to contact greenworks for a replacement but the phone number said over an hour hold times. When I tried the website I got nothing but error codes and the page wouldn’t load. Don’t waste your time buying garbage from this horrible company. May as well put your money directly in the trash
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I just received the saw yesterday and I can say I was very pleased with it.It went together in 5 minutes and after 2 hours of battery charging it was ready to go.I sawed a 3 inch diameter limb in no time at all.It worked very well .For the money I think it is great.Don't forget to get some bar oil and keep the reservoir full so you don't burn up the chain.It is light enough so most anybody can use it.I recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jed

customer_reviews.title: Great for the back yard home maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for the price. It is engineered/designed well and does the job i needed. I am 70 years old and cannot do much hard work. The two amp battery works longer than I can. But I needed to crawl over a steep bank to trim obstructive trees for the view. It was really thick with tree suckers or saplings. It cuts the six inches like it says it will, even eight inches with some patience on my part. I can see where the real landscaper would want to pay twice the price for a more durable product. But this fits my niche well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I am a 68 year old woman under 5' tall and have never owned a chain saw or such. I had a huge amount trimming to do and got too tired using my 12' tree saw /lopper. Much of the work is in woods, so I could not use a plug-in. I found this unit fairly easy to use and very effective. It is still work, but much better.
customer_reviews.author: tilemom

customer_reviews.title: What a lifesaver.  This thing cuts forever before needing a recharge.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is awesome. I had a black and decker 18v pole saw for years that finally crapped out on me, so I tried this. What a difference. It cuts for days, charges fast and has plenty of power. The only negatives are it is shorter and heavier than the Black and Decker. The button location is wonky, I wish it was further back in the handle. It does leak oil during storage, but I am thankful for the oil pan anyway. The B&D didn't have an oil reservoir. I was so impressed with this I bought the 40v chainsaw when it was on sale (haven't used that yet)
customer_reviews.author: fanny hamsteak

customer_reviews.title: The Best Cordless Polesaw for DIY jobs.
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely fabulous pole saw. I purchased it to trim the trees on my property. This saw is powerful Once I charged the battery and added the oil it was ready to go. The battery charger last a long. I have used it several times and have only charged the battery once.
customer_reviews.author: Lamont

customer_reviews.title: This is one amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: Changed the chain one time over the years and most likely because it ran by mistake through soil. Otherwise, it cuts through wood like knife in a butter. I just wished if the oil reservoir was easier to see through. 5 stars for lasting the last two years without a major problem while reaching unusual places. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: kafman

product_meta.title: Greenworks 8.5' 40V Cordless Pole Saw, 2.0 AH Battery Included 20672
product_meta.description: Style:2Ah Battery and Charger| Pattern Name:SawGreen Works GMAX 40-Volt 2.0 Amp Hour Lithium-Ion Pole Saw with 8-inch Bar and Chain, Includes Battery and Charger, Model No.20672.
feature_bullets: G-MAX 40V Li-Ion Battery System powers multiple tools for complete yard system-includes 2Ah Battery and Charger
8-Inch bar and chain for easy trimming of branches. Product weight: 8.360 pounds
Easy adjust chain tensioning system for quick tightening of the chain
Automatic oiler applies oil to bar and chain when needed to ensure durability and optimal use with a translucent oil tank for clear view of oil level
3-piece aluminum shaft can be extended to 8 ft. for the perfect extended

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,270 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
